Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2025
Review Content:
Do to the insanity of PE (American) series we helped support our local family owned shop. Do to prices. Trainer box and binder to see if the pulls were as bad as first witnessed. Pulls were bad. So we started doing some research. Decided to purchase two boxes of this series (Japanese) instead. We pulled some great additions to our collection. Including a full art.
Looked at current going price. Found two more boxes from another seller and decided well this might be the last chance we get at this price let‚Äôs go for it and all went better than could have imagined.

There are more hits with the Japanese packs than the American if you are unfamiliar with them. The EX cards are meant to be played with so there are many you can end up with 4-5 plus. The rare cards are still rare. You can spend a lot of money and still never pull some of them.
If you do choose to take the risk and freak out over some of your pulls do not rip one of your full arts. If you manage to have a dup bulk card you can (however never recommend) do the ink test. Do some research, American and Japanese cards differ when verifying authenticity. The ink test for one is not the same as the other. Also know what you are looking at. Lots of counterfeit boxes.

Please remember to check the sellers feed back.
We have had a lot of luck with items shipped from our local Amazon distribution centers and ordering from Companies with a 98 plus rating with money back guarantee.

Hope this helps the Community.
Make it a wonderful day!

Likely will buy again in the future.
